node.text: Sopes are rounds of griddled masa with a little rim around the edge to hold delicious fillings. “In my house, sopes were always filled with refried black beans, pulled chicken, chopped romaine lettuce, crema, crumbled fresh cheese, and then one or two salsas and guacamole or avocado to top,” writes Epi contributor @Fanygerson. But sopes are made to be customized, she says. Learn the cooking method in the video above, and check out the link in our bio to get the recipe.

node.text: Gorditas are one of the most popular street foods in Mexico. According to @fanygerson, the translation means “little fatties,” and they’re thick masa pockets that are toasted on a comal, then stuffed with fillings. Watch the video to learn all of Gerson’s tips and tricks, then click the link in our bio for the recipe—and a sweet variation, too.

node.text: You can find tlacoyos all across Mexico—and they’re one of @fanygerson’s favorite street food snacks. The thick oval-shaped masa patties are crispy on the outside, stuffed with beans or other fillings, and piled high with a refreshing cactus salad. Here, Fany shows you how to make them, step by step, to devour right away or stock your freezer. Read more and get the recipe at the link in our bio.

node.text: “For many families, making tamales is a ritual, and younger and older generations each have specific roles in the process,” writes Epi contributor, chef @fanygerson. Here, Gerson walks you through the whole method, step by step, so you can make the fluffiest, most flavorful tamales of your life. Read more and get the recipe at the link in our bio.

dash_info.video_dash_manifest:

node.text: When chef and cookbook author Fany Gerson (@fanygerson) first moved to New York from Mexico over 20 years ago, it wasn’t a matter of *wanting* to find good tortillas—she *needed* them. Mass-produced tortillas from supermarkets and delis had nothing in common with the supple, fragrant fresh tortillas she knew and loved in Mexico. So she started making her own—now she’s here to share her tips, step by step. Read more and get the recipe at the link in our bio. Director: @c.emanuelsmith DP: @bendewster Editor: @elliottjchrist

node.text: Senior Food Editor @acstockwell is making her Pantry Dinner Salad With Polenta Croutons, for Night 4 of Cooking Through It Round 3! Here’s a replay of her first Live ever.

node.text: One day, you will be in a market, and you will pass the coconuts. They will grab your attention. You'll say to yourself, "I'm going to buy this coconut." You settle at the register, and bring your groceries home. You put most of them away. As you hold up that last item, you will ask yourself: "Why did I buy this coconut?" At least we can help answer how to open it!

node.title: 50 People Try to Crack Open a Coconut

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by epicurious on August 19, 2021. May be an image of drink.

node.text: Vodka cocktails can be easy without being basic. To make this beauty, you’ll add rosemary sprigs to a bottle of vodka, then shake your homemade flavored vodka with tangy grapefruit juice, lemon, and a little simple syrup. It’s the perfect refresher for your next porch hang. Find the recipe at the link in bio, along with a lot more vodka drinks for your next happy hour. Photo @chelsealouisekyle

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by epicurious on August 19, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text: Save your vegetables from an untimely death between the grates with a grill basket. The best ones will transform your grill into a tool that can cook just about anything with ease, even delicate ingredients that are cut into small pieces. There are lots of variations out there, including square stainless steel pans with sloping sides and closed-top options. Click through the link in bio to see our guide to the best grill basket for your budget. Photo @j_deleo, Food Styling @lililbeijing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by epicurious on August 18, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: If you just can’t bring yourself to make one more pie, try putting those peaches on pork. In this new recipe from Epi’s Associate Food Editor Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar), tender and juicy grilled pork chops get a spiced honey glaze and a spoonful of summer’s best condiment: peach pico de gallo. The salsa is sweet, salty, sour, and spicy all at once, cutting through the richness of the pork. (Yes, you can sub in nectarines for the peaches, too.) Make the most of these last weeks of stone fruit season, and check out this grill-ready recipe at the link in bio. Photo @j_deleo, Food Styling @lililbeijing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by epicurious on August 18, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: If you're in dire need of some summer squash cooking inspiration, Epi has 47 recipes that you can try right now. This marinated summer squash salad comes together easily on a weeknight, though you’ll want to take the time to salt the squash beforehand for optimal flavor. If you’re lucky enough to snag some squash blossoms, fold the flowers into a cheesy quesadilla on fresh tortillas. Or sear some zucchini and chicken, then cover in lemony garlic oil with olives and chiles for a dinner you’ll love. And don’t forget all those grill-ready recipes! Get them all at the link in bio. Photos @chelsielcraig, @pedenmunk, @j_deleo , Food Styling @mollybaz, @acstockwell, Prop Styling @emilyeisen

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by epicurious on August 18, 2021. May be an image of food.
Photo by epicurious on August 18, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and food.
Photo by epicurious on August 18, 2021. May be an image of souvlakia and indoor.
Photo by epicurious on August 17, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: Eggplant is divine in baked dishes and pastas, but you can do so much more with this versatile vegetable. Toss seared eggplant with buttermilk dressing and chunks of avocado for a creamy, veggie-filled salad, or roast thick slices and stack them in sandwiches. Even easier? Char whole eggplants until they collapse and blend the flesh into dip. Click the link in bio to discover the dozens and dozens of eggplant recipes (67, to be exact) we find ourselves making over and over. Photo @yungbludlau

Get a better brew by keeping your grinder in good health. Urnex Grindz are little food-safe tablets that clean out coffee buildup and the oils that coat the blades of burr grinders, which can lower a machine's lifespan and lead to mucky flavors. Trust us, your morning cup will thank you. Head over to the link in bio to get these right now. Photo @travis.rainey

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by epicurious on August 16, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: Farro is a powerhouse grain that's nutty, chewy, and satisfying—and it’s easy to cook. Equally good as a picnic side or a hearty dinner salad, this farro and tomato salad uses bright summer produce, lots of herbs, and an umami vinaigrette. Epi editors have collected 40 other great ways to use farro, including our favorite grain bowls, easy salads, farro risotto, hearty pancakes, and more. Just click the link in bio to get inspired. Photo @pedenmunk

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by epicurious on August 16, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: Don’t dump that pickle juice! Liquid leftovers hold a TON of flavor that you can put to use in the kitchen. The brine from feta, fresh mozzarella, and even olives can make your everyday weeknight recipes even better. Use it as the base for a salad dressing, or even a marinade for meat and vegetables. Learn how to turn all these leftovers into something delicious—just check out the link in bio. Photo @chelsealouisekyle, Food Styling @katherinesacks

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by epicurious on August 15, 2021. May be an image of dessert.

node.text:
"Why not embrace the absurdity of the time and roll with something that makes everyone happy?” asks Epi contributor Max Falkowitz, who thinks we should revisit the idea of the ice cream social—by throwing an ice cream dinner party.
Here's how: Make a batch of bourbon butterscotch or buttermilk ice cream if you have time, or grab a few of your favorite pints from the store. Bring out bowls of chocolate-covered pretzels, Heath bars, caramel corn, corn nuts, quick-pickled strawberries, even potato chips and Takis. And don’t forget that homemade whipped cream and hot fudge sauce! Head over to the link in bio to start planning your ice cream dinner. Photo @j_deleo, Food Styling @lililbeijing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by epicurious on August 14, 2021. May be an image of food and knife.

node.text: Serrated knives are an essential tool, and a good one makes all the difference when you're slicing into a loaf of bread. Epi tested 10 serrated knives to find the best slicer for your needs. Whether you are looking for one to fit small hands, or a more budget-friendly option, we have a plenty of info to help you find the right one for your needs. Check out the lineup at the link in bio. Photo @travis.rainey

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by epicurious on August 13, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and food.

node.text: We love pesto as much as the next person, but there's so much more you can do with basil. Put those flavor-filled leaves to good use in summer salads, thirst-quenching cocktails, and rich desserts. Epi editors have compiled a collection of 87 basil recipes to get you through the summer. Just head over to the link in bio to try them out ASAP. Photo @chelsielcraig, Food Styling @mpearljones

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by epicurious on August 13, 2021. May be an image of dessert.

node.text: If you have time to whip some cream, you can make this deceptively simple ice cream icebox cake. (Trust us, your future self will thank you.) Chocolate fans: This variation calls for chocolate ice cream and chocolate graham crackers, while the blackberry jam-flavored whipped cream adds a surprising, fruity element to an otherwise classic dessert. Try it for yourself—just head over to the link in bio. Photo @j_deleo, Food Styling @gatton_michelle
